name: Pullman Brisbane King George Square

reviews.text: I stay here for business. I particularly like that the rooms are bigger than usual and the wine in the mini bar not over priced. I also love the size of the bathroom. Only caution is that they might try to put you in the citigate side of the hotel which is a huge let down. Overall one of my favourite places to stay. And I travel a lot.
reviews.title: I stay here often and it is way above average.

reviews.text: I am a believer that the standard of a hotel should be reflected in its rating so, if I am staying at a 4 star like the Sebel, I expect to be wow'd by the establishment... and the Sebel was ok - it did not disappoint however I have to admit I was not taken off my feet.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Brisbane's CBD - will definitely suit the corporate traveller.

reviews.text: The Sebel King George Square (not to be confused with the Sebel Suites on Charlotte Street) is conveniently located at the cnr of Ann & Roma Streets. A 25 mins ride on the Airtrain, followed by an additional 5-7 mins walk from Central Station will get you there.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms but breakfast and management appalling.

reviews.text: The lobby is massive with comfy couches to sit on and relax. There are computers from which you can access the internet and phones as well. The staff @ reception were very nice and check-in was very quick. Those checking-out have the option to use the express check-out lane which speeds up the process. There is also a concierge desk to attend to any other needs that you may have.
reviews.title: Great for business

reviews.text: Bistro Allure is located on the Ground Floor and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. The KG Bar provides a sleek and funky setting where you can relax and enjoy a drink.
reviews.title: Corporate stay excellent, I wouldn't bring guests though....

reviews.text: Stayed overnight and had a room with a balcony on the 3rd floor. The room was large with 2 beds , bathroom large, facilities great. Everything was clean and decor lovely. Although a little bit of road noise being on the lower floor it was worth having a large outdoor area so you don't feel locked in a fish bowl. Staff were great at check in. If driving just be prepared for the Valet parking fee - you will need this as being in the city there really isn't parking. The foyer is welcoming and clean with lots of seating, a cafe, restaurant and bar all available. they do have some great packages for dinner and breakfast with late check out. It is close to everything you may need and a cab rank out the front is a plus. Would definitely stay here whenever in Brisbane again.
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. Refurbishment has made the place bang up to the minute in looks and feel. Staff were very efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: Overnight via Wotif Mystery Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice rooms, we were upgraded to a balcony room - unfortunately the door didn't lock, the neighboring rooms both had smokers so outside was just plumes of smoke, and it looked out from Level 3 to just above the overpass next to the hotel. Is advertised as a 5 star hotel (on the sebel section, citigate said 4 stars...) but its fairly dated everywhere other than the foyer and within the rooms - as soon as you go to the pool / outside / balcony areas they are dated, cold, concrete with no character.
reviews.title: Pretty Standard

reviews.text: Tried to get room service just after midnight as the restaurant, bar and cafe were all shut already, there were no dairy free, vegetarian options other than $13 wedges - but were told it would be a 35 - 45 min wait on these which was a little surprising! The walk to several places such as the supper club (or even pie face or hungry jacks) and the wait for an entire menu of late night feasts was a much more pleasant experience - and we were back in our room in under an hour.
reviews.title: This was really nice

reviews.text: Nothing was significantly bad but nothing special.
reviews.title: Citigate King George Square Brisbane

reviews.text: This is was my first stay at this Brisbane inner city hotel. I was there for only one night on business and apart from the rather officious porter on arrival it was very much up to standard. Check in was polite and efficient I had one the newer refurbished hotel rooms wish was very well appointed and comfortable, both room and bathroom are spacious, shower was excellent. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Was impressed

reviews.text: My mum and i have stayed here several times to celebrate mothers' day or birthdays. Get a balcony room. Ask for city views. You wont regert it. The church across the way looks amazing when lit up at night. Fantastic location - only two blocks from Queen St Mall so great for hitting the shops. Always found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. Beds comfy, nice linen, lots of pillows (a must), bathtub, yummy room service (dinner) and buffet breakfast (highly recommended). You want an egg white omelette for breakfast ? sure - no problem ! We shop a bit, come back and rest, then go shop some more. Valet parking is very handy. Might have to come back with my husband next time as he feels left out. Ha ha.
reviews.title: Great place to spoil yourself - or your mum

reviews.text: I found the hotel staff friendly and efficient. The spot was central and close to Queen St Mall. The rooms and bathroom were big enough and the beds comfortable.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Nice clean rooms and scored the top floor. Is a stones throw from the city. Nice place to stay parking is 30 bucks a day which I suppose is ok given it's multiple entry/ exit
reviews.title: Wot if mystery deal

reviews.text: I had a recent overnight stay here and found this to be extremely good value. The rooms were clean, lovely hot showers and very comfortable beds. We had room service breakfast which was served promptly and very enjoyable. The hotels location is perfect- a 3-5 min walk will get you to either central or Roma street train stations and the mall. Would highly recommend and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Location,location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw a weekend special advertised for $199 including the upgrade to the tower (it was an extra $40) and decided to book as we were going to the airport early the next day.
reviews.title: Nothing like what we expected
Ok but nothing special
reviews.text: The rate included parking and also buffet breakfast for two.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we left at 6.00am which was too early for breakfast as it started at 6.30am which I thought was too late.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking was good.
reviews.title: Dissappointment

reviews.text: The room was old fashioned and not very exciting - not worth the money at all.
reviews.title: Very pleasant and well located

aka: Citigate King George Square Brisbane Hotel Brisbane
description: Stylish Brisbane accommodation located within walking distance of the Queen Street Mall shopping precinct offering guests a full range of services and facilities in relaxed yet sophisticated surroundings. Facilities include restaurant, cafe and bar, fully equipped gymnasium, rooftop swimming pool and Brisbane's largest hotel conference and meeting space.
